elements.text: 1: EXT. DESERT WORLD
F/X VICKI AND STEVEN ARE RUNNING ACROSS THE SURFACE OF AN
WORLD.
Are you sure the TARDIS is this way?
For heaven's sake — yes! The Doctor’s waiting for us, come on!
F/X 2 X ANTOIM — CREATURES WITH THROATY, GUTTURAL VOICES —
APPROACH.
#1: (OFF) Enemy in sight.
They’ve found us!
There’s the TARDIS! I can see the —
#2: (OFF) Fire.
Vicki, look out!
F/X LASER-TYPE BLAST; HITS GROUND BY VICKI.
CRIES OUT
Keep going!
F/X ANOTHER BLAST AS THEY REACH TARDIS.
The door’s open — Go! Go!
F/X THEY PILE INTO THE TARDIS.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 3
2: INT. TARDIS [CONTINUOUS]
F/X CIRCA 1965 TARDIS BACKGROUND HUM.
Doctor, it’s us! Close the d-[oors] (BREAKS OFF)
F/X DOORS CLOSE.
Thank heavens! Those creatures were right on our — (SURPRISE) Oh!
Vicki. Steven. It’s, er... very good to see you.
Who are you?
I’m... the Doctor.
STEVEN/VICKI: The Doctor! ?
WHO THEME
FX: AFTER THE THEME, WE RESUME THE SCENE:
Quite so: the Doctor.
No you’re not.
I realise, I do look different -
You’re not joking.
F/X TARDIS ROCKS. SOMETHING STRONG IS BATTERING THE DOORS.
They’re right outside the TARDIS!
That’s all we need!
Who are ‘they’, might one ask?
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 4
The Antoim.
Great round things covered in spikes — they float and smother and kill people! Ugh.
(ALMOST NOSTALGIC) Oh yes.
F/X SLAM! AGAINST THE DOORS. TARDIS ROCKS AGAIN.
We’ve got to get out of here.
Yes, of course.
F/X DOCTOR STARTS TO ACTIVATE TARDIS CONTROLS.
What are you doing?
Getting us out of here.
But we can’t leave the Doctor behind.
We’re not leaving the Doctor behind.
What are you doing with the controls? Only the Doctor can —
F/X TARDIS TAKES OFF.
You were saying?
How did you do that?
Maybe... he is the Doctor.
I am. It’s... difficult to explain. For some reason, I appear to have suddenly switched places with the Doctor you know. I’m the Doctor - the same Doctor - but from a different point in my life.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 5
So you’re.. a younger version of the Doctor?
In a sense.
(TO STEVEN) I suppose he could be.
But if you’re younger than our Doctor, you wouldn’t know who we are.. and yet when we came in, you used our names.
Of course I know who you are: Steven and Vicki. (EXPLAINS) You see, I’m a younger version, but I’m actually older.
Do you age backwards or something?
To an extent. Look, Vicki — only the Doctor would know about the chat we had when we first met, yes? When I told you to give Barbara another chance after she shot Sandy.
Sandy?
My pet sand beast.
Your pet wh-?
(INTERRUPTING) And how we travelled to Rome together, and how that assassin attacked us at the tavern.
Assass-?
(LAUGHS) And you threw him out of the window, and I couldn’t stop laughing!
(UNDER HIS BREATH) It doesn’t sound that funny.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 6

And if we’ve just had a brush with the Antoim.. (CASTS HIS MIND BACK) Aha, yes! We helped the colonists escape, and my plan to put a stop to the Antoim didn’t work, so we decided to just run away and leave them on a deserted planet.
And they swore they’d track you down and destroy you.
I’d be surprised if they could find a way off that planet, never mind halfway across the galaxy. They’re remarkably stupid.
But why are you here instead of our Doctor? I don’t understand.
Neither do I. One moment I was in ‘my’ TARDIS, as it were; the next I was in... well, his. I mean yours.
How?
Some sort of temporal glitch, perhaps...? I might just switch back or...
A BEAT
Or.. all this is rather less straightforward than I’d hoped.
F/X TARDIS LANDING BEGINS.
We’re landing.
And I know where. I know exactly where.
Well that’s a first. The Doctor - our Doctor - never knows where we’re landing.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 7
I know because it’s already happened, to me. (F/X: AS
SEQUENCE CONCLUDES: ) When next I open those doors, we’ll be in the city of Ravenna near the northeast coast of Italy in the year 540 AD.
F/X SCANNER ON.
There, you see? On the scanner?
I’ll take your word for it.
(ADMONISHINGLY) Oh, Steven, buck up — it looks nice.
(UNCERTAIN) I suppose we should go outside.
F/X OPENS DOORS. RAVENNA ATMOS OUTSIDE.
You don’t sound too sure.

At this moment, I can remember how this whole journey turned out, because I’ve lived through it before. But as soon as I step out of the TARDIS, the timelines will change, it’1ll be me who does all this instead of your Doctor, and I won’t remember what happened first time around because it won’t have happened yet. If you see what I mean.
(BEAT) Yes, absolutely.
Really?
No.
It’s essential that I do everything as your Doctor would have done it. Anything else, and I'll have interfered with my own
timeline and... there could be severe consequences if that were to happen. Along the way I’1l try to work out what’s happened and how to bring your Doctor back. All right?
All right.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page
You definitely believe he’s the Doctor?
(BEAT) Yes. There’s just something... Doctorish about him.
I’1ll take that as a compliment.
(RESIGNED) All right. Let’s go.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 9
3: EXT. RAVENNA ALLEY [CONTINUOUS]
F/X QUIET BACKSTREET. DOCTOR SHUTS TARDIS DOOR BEHIND.
What’s so special about this place... Doctor?
Ravenna? Well, it was once the capital city of the Western Roman Empire — until its collapse, of course.
Western Roman Empire?

Yes, the Empire became split, with a Eastern Empire ruled from Constantinople, often called the Byzantine (biZANtyne) Empire. But now, the Eastern Empire is the only Roman Empire still standing, and Ravenna is capital of the Kingdom of the Ostrogoths.
Ostrowhats?
Ostrogoths. They occupy large parts of Italy at this time. This was supposed to be their great city, conceived as a rival to Constantinople or even Rome itself.
So what went wrong? The place looks half-finished. (HE KICKS OVER A PILE OF WOOD & RUBBLE.) Or half-begun.
We’re in the middle of the Gothic Wars. Ravenna is about to fall to the Romans, who are re-conquering Italy. Their army will march on the city at any moment.
Is it safe?
Oh yes. As sieges go, it’s all quite low-key. — This way, I think.
F/X THEY WALK. FADE.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 10
4: EXT. ENCAMPMENT OUTSIDE RAVENNA
F/X BELISARIUS IS DRESSING FOR BATTLE.
FUSSING OVER THE STRAPS ON HIS MASTER’S BREASTPLATE
Belisarius, for the last time, I urge you not to go into the city personally.

(WINCING SLIGHTLY AS THE STRAPS ARE TIGHTENING) The whole point of going into Ravenna is to make them think I’m going to accept their offer, Procopius. I can’t send someone else to accept on my behalf.
At least take more than just a small complement of household troops.
I don’t want it to look like I’m invading.
But you are invading.
Which is why it’s important that it doesn’t look that way. Tighter across the chest.
(PULLING ON THE CHEST STRAPS) You’1l be vastly outnumbered in there.
We.
What?
We'll be vastly outnumbered in there. You’re coming too.
(STOPS ASSISTING WITH THE ARMOUR) Me? Why?
You're my secretary and legal advisor. If I was going in to negotiate a transfer of power, you’re the first person I'd bring.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 11
I’m not sure that I’1l be [of any —]
You’re coming. Now where’s my sword..? (FINDING IT) Aha!
All right — but please, at least bring a medic with you. Just in case you’re beset by an assassin, [or —]
(TYING ON HIS SWORD BELT) All right, bring Quintus. But it’s perfectly safe.
How can you be sure?
(FINISHING HIS ARMOUR) They’re willing to make me Western Emperor, they have too much respect [to —]
A very generous offer. Which gives them ample reason to be angry when they find out you’re not actually going to take it.
(NO MORE ARMOUR PREP) If they had any stomach for a fight they wouldn’t have made this offer at all. It’s my job to fight wars, Procopius, and it’s your job to deal with the paperwork. Come on.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 12
5: EXT. RAVENNA STREET
F/X DOCTOR, VICKI AND STEVEN WALK THROUGH THE CITY. A FEW
MILLING ABOUT.
Not a very lively place, is it?
Everyone’s on edge. Hoping it’1ll all be over soon. Which it Wail.
How did people live in these days? Never knowing if you’re going to be conquered and someone else is going to be in charge...
F/X COMMOTION BEGINS, SHORT DISTANCE AWAY.
Hello — here he comes.
Who?
Belisarius. General of the Roman army. Already a legend, and he’s only just turned forty.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 13
6: EXT. RAVENNA STREET (WITH BELISARIUS) [CONTINUOUS]
F/X BELISARIUS MARCHING, HIS TROOPS BEHIND HIM. CROWD HAS
AROUND.
(MUTTERING UNDER HIS BREATH) What happened to Quintus? He was at the back, wasn’t he?
(QUIET) Eyes front, Procopius. (LOUDLY) All hail the emperor!
FEW BEGRUDGING ‘HAILS’
(LOW) Not many joining in with the ‘hails’, Belisarius.
(LOW) They’ve let us in now — what choice do they have? (LOUDLY) Which way to the palace, Procopius?
(LOUDLY) That way, General.
(LOUDLY) To the palace! Cheer, good people, cheer!
CHEERS
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 14
7: EXT. RAVENNA STREET [CONTINUOUS]
F/X BACK TO THE DOCTOR AND CO, AS BELISARIUS PASSES BY.
(CAUGHT UP IN THE EXCITEMENT) They’re cheering him on now.
I thought you said this was a siege?
(LOW) The Ostrogoths think he’s here to accept their offer to become Western Emperor.
(LOW) But he’s not?
(LOW) No. He’ll go the palace and declare that he’s conquered the city. Ravenna will have no choice but to surrender.
(STILL EXCITED) Shall we follow the crowd? See him enter the palace?
Are you sure that’s a good idea?
I told you, this is a bloodless siege. Belisarius just sort of batters them with his reputation, so he doesn’t even have to fight. I’d rather like to meet him.
You don’t have to come, Steven.
Shouldn’t we stay together?
True. Back in these days, my problems always seemed to begin with someone wandering off.
I want to go.
(WITH A SIGH) All right, we’ll all go. Come on.
F/X THEY WALK. FADE.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 15
8: INT. HOUSE IN RAVENNA
F/X CROWDS BELOW. DOOR OPENS.
(SURPRISED & SLIGHTLY FLUSTERED) Quintus! What are you doing here?
We agreed to meet here. Your message -
Yes, but aren’t you meant to be with Belisarius and the others? You can’t just sneak off.
They’ve got other things to think about. This room’s a bit dingy, Sophia. How long have you been living here?
Since I arrived in Ravenna seven weeks ago.
Was this really the best room you could find?
No, but you said we needed something with a high balcony.
Oh yes, I did say that. Ah! Shutters, too!
F/X MONK CROSSES TO WINDOW, THROWS SHUTTERS OPEN. INHALES.
Perfect!
Why do we need a high balcony?
Hmm? Oh, because there’s someone I want to find in the crowd. (SCANS THE CROWD BELOW) Three people, actually... And here they come now. See?
Who are they? They are dressed so strangely...
She’s called Vicki, he’s the Doctor and that is Steven. And I came up here to tell you to protect them. With this.
F/X MONK BRINGS A CROSSBOW FROM A BAG.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 16
A crossbow?
You can fire it, I’ve seen you. You’re very good. Positively Amazonian - only with a full complement of [you know whats].
(INTERRUPTING) It’s not very subtle though, is it?
When have you ever known me to be subtle?
Fair point.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 17
9: INT. RAVENNA PALACE
F/X DOORS ARE FLUNG OPEN, BELISARIUS AND HIS MEN MARCH IN.
Men of Ravenna! I demand your immediate surrender! — I am Flavius Belisarius of the Imperial Roman Army, and I take this city in the name of the Emperor Justinian!
F/X DOORS CLOSED.
(EXHALES) Well, that’s the marching done. — Is there any wine in this palace? I’m parched.
Fetch wine for the General! (CLAPS HIS HANDS) Wine for the General at once!
FX: SOMEONE SCURRIES OFF TO FETCH THE WINE.
(LESS PUBLICLY) Procopius, tell the crowd outside what’s happened.
Why me?
I need to stay in the palace until the handover of power is complete.
Can’t we both stay in the palace until the handover of power is complete?

Tell them anyone who offers no resistance will be left in peace. We won’t loot their homes or defile their women, and we won’t set fire to anything. That should quieten them down. (A BEAT) — Go on, go!
F/X PROCOPIUS HURRIES OUT. CROSS TO:
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 18
10: EXT. RAVENNA PALACE
F/X CROWD LIVENS UP AS PROCOPIUS EMERGES.
I can’t see. Some walking rampart is blocking my view. Ow! (TO THE PERSON IN FRONT OF HER) That was my foot, clumsy! (TO THE DOCTOR, AS SHE NURSES HER FOOT) What’s happening now?
Someone’s coming out of the palace.
(DISTANT, TO CROWD) I bear a message from Flavius Belisarius.
He was with Belisarius when they came past us. Who is he?
F/X CHEERS.
He is returning the city of Ravenna to its rightful place as part of the true Roman Empire.
#1 Never!
F/X CROWD DISQUIET; BIT UNSURE.
And he pledges that all those who surrender without violence will be allowed to keep their wealth, their homes, and.. their families safe.
F/X MIXED REACTION. A FEW ANGRY SHOUTS BREAK OUT.
#1 No surrender! No surrender to the Roman invader!
F/X SHOUTS OF AGREEMENT.
Doctor...?
Yes, Vicki, things seem to be getting a little heated. How’s that foot of yours?
Recovering fast.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 19
Delighted to hear it. Steven?
Back to the TARDIS?
Yes, back to the TARDIS. Come on. (TRYING TO PUSH THROUGH CROWD) Excuse me. Please!
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 20
11: INT. HOUSE [CONTINUOUS]
F/X COMMOTION IS AUDIBLE FROM UP HERE.
Blast! Can you still see them, Sophia?
Just about, Quintus. Over to the right. They’re trying to get clear, but the crowd keeps closing around them.
Getting rowdy out there, isn’t it?
I didn’t expect this.
Expect the unexpected, my dear. I’1ll be needed down there — you just be ready to shoot if necessary. The Doctor isn’t supposed to die here... just make sure he doesn’t.
F/X MONK HURRIES FROM THE ROOM.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 21
12: EXT. RAVENNA PALACE [CONTINUOUS ]
F/X QUITE CHAOTIC IN THE STREETS NOW. THEY SPEAK ABOVE THE
NOISE OF THE CROWD.
Steven? Steven! Doctor, I’ve can’t see Steven in the crowd!
Me neither. Let’s head back to the TARDIS and hopefully we’1l meet him there.
I thought you said this would go off peacefully?
I don’t understand. They should be accepting his terms.
#1 Coward! He’s betrayed us and you think we should roll over?
Good citizen — Belisarius has an army out there and men on the inside — you don’t stand a chance!
#1 What about our pride? We’re not going down without a fight.
F/X DRAWS A SWORD.
#1 Starting with traitors like you.
Doctor!
F/X CROSSBOW BOLT SHOOTS THROUGH THE AIR AND HITS THE CITIZEN
IN THE CHEST. THE CROWD ON EITHER SIDE REACT.
#1 Time you accepted my terms, you trai- (CRIES OUT, FALLS BACK)
What on earth was that? What’s happened to him?
(EXAMINES HIM) He’s been shot with a crossbow bolt. He’s dead...!
Then there’s nothing we can do for him. Doctor, let’s go!
F/X VICKI BUSTLES HIM AWAY. CROSS TO:
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 22
13: EXT. RAVENNA PALACE (CLOSE BY
F/X STEVEN’S IN ANOTHER PART OF THE CROWD.
Doctor? Vicki? Doctor! — Please, let me through — I need to find my friends...
#2 Oi! No need to push! What’s the hurry anyway?
I’m sorry, I just need to get through to my friends —
#2 What friends? Your Roman friends?
Don’t be stupid. Please!
#2 Oh — stupid, am I? I’11 show you who’s [PUNCHING] stupid!
F/X WHACK! CITIZEN CLUBS STEVEN UNCONSCIOUS.
GASPS AS HE GOES DOWN
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 23
14: EXT. ALLEY
F/X DOCTOR AND VICKI RUSH TOWARDS TARDIS.
Steven isn’t here.
Maybe he went inside the TARDIS to wait.
You’re the only one with a key.
Oh. Yes. You two should really have keys [of your —] Down!
F/X FOOT SCRAPES.
(LOW) What?
(LOW) There’s someone hiding behind the TARDIS. I saw their shadow. (RAISING VOICE) Come out from behind the box and we won’t, er, hurt you.
F/X PROCOPIUS STEPS OUT.
Please. I’m not, I’m not armed, I’m not a soldier —
Hey, he’s the man who talked to the crowd.
So he is.
You’re Goths?
Goths? No, we're...
— just visiting the city. Who are you?
Me? Nobody.
Everybody’s somebody.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 24
Well I’m not. I’m just Belisarius’ legal adviser.
Procopius of Caesarea?!
(BEAT) How did you know that?
Author of ‘The Wars Of Justinian’, and ‘The Secret History’. It’s an honour to meet you!
I haven’t written any (hist—)
Not yet, but you’re thinking about it.
Yes, well, I mean I have accompanied Belisarius on several military excursions and I’ve made close-hand observations of — Look, who are you?
I’m Vicki, and this is the Doctor.
You were at the siege of Rome.
Ah yes, it was my privilege to witness —
Doctor! Shouldn’t we be looking for Steven?
Of course. We’ve been separated from our friend. You haven’t seen him, have you? Tall, dark-haired, square-jawed -
(INTERRUPTING) I don’t think you’1ll find anyone until the fighting’s calmed down. I tried to get back into the palace, but some of the crowd went for the doors. Cut me off.
So what do we do?
You stay here, Vicki — I’1ll go out and look. Procopius can tell you all about the capture of Carthage. Back in a jiffy.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 25
F/X DOCTOR LEAVES.
(AFTER DOCTOR) He can tell me what about Carthage?
Ah. Well, if you want to know about Carthage you have to go back to the Battle of Ad Decimum (DEKKYm'm), ten miles from Carthage.
Right.
Unfortunately, Gelimer’s (GELLYmuh) intelligence was sound, and he had advance warning of the pending arrival of the Roman army...
F/X FADE DOWN.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 26
15: EXT. RAVENNA PALACE
F/X SNATCHES OF THE PREVIOUS SCENE & OF THE MONK’S ‘YOUNG MAN’
FADE IN & OUT, SWIMMING AROUND THE STEREOFIELD, SOMETIMES MUFFLED, SOMETIMES SHARP. THEY RESOLVE INTO STEVEN BEING SHAKEN
BY THE MONK. STILL A BIT ROWDY OUTSIDE.
Young man? Hello?
Whu...?
Don’t worry, the worst of the fighting’s over. Are you all right?
(SHUDDERING, PAINED BREATH) Doctor. Find the Doctor.
You’re in luck. It so happens that I’m a physician.
No.. different kind of Doc—
Shh... save your strength. You’1ll need it.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 27
16: EXT. ALLEY
F/X DOCTOR RETURNS DURING PROCOPIUS’ SPEECH.
But then — the turning point of the battle: we slew Gelimer’s brother, thereby throwing the commander of the opposition forces into crisis and enabling us to regroup. We [then —]
(WITH RELIEF, HAVING BEEN BORED) Doctor!
(APPROACHING) Glad you’re still safe.
Yes, it’s all been quiet down here.
No sign of Steven?
I’m afraid not. But the fighting’s calming down.
I’11 come and help you look, then.
But I haven’t even got to the taking of Carthage yet.
You can tell us later. Come on.
F/X THEY WALK TOWARDS THE END OF THE ALLEYWAY.
If your friend was caught up in the fighting, it’s possible he was mistaken for a Goth and taken prisoner.
Oh no.
If that was the case... (STOPS WALKING) perhaps I could speak to Belisarius?
Yes, I could get you an audience.
Vicki — can you keep looking for Steven while I deal with this?
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 28
I suppose. After all, you’re the one who knows all about glad- handing historical figures.
Historical?
He’1ll be at the palace, I take it...?
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 29
17: EXT. ANOTHER ALLEY
F/X MONK SHOULDERING WOUNDED STEVEN ALONG.
Wh-where are we going...?
(GRUNTING WITH THE EFFORT) Don’t you worry, my young friend. I’1ll take care of you. You’ll see...
F/X THEY MOVE ON.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 30
18: INT. PALACE — THRONE ROOM
F/X FADE UP. DOOR OPENS A CRACK. WE ARE POSITIONED WITH
BELISARIUS; THE DOOR IS ABOUT 20 FEET AWAY.
Belisarius...? Is this a good time?
Yes, yes. Where have you been, Procopius?
I was cut off from the palace during the fighting.
F/X OPENS DOOR WIDER TO ADMIT DOCTOR.
This man helped me — he’s called the Doctor.
Let him approach.
(WALKING UP TO BELISARIUS) General, hello. A friend of mine was caught in the upheaval, I’m trying to find him.
Whose side was he on?
He wasn’t — we’re just visitors. But we wondered if perhaps he'd been mistaken for a Goth, and captured.
If he was wearing clothes like yours, with your legs all covered like that, doubtless he was mistaken for a Goth.
Right.
In which case, he’s gone.
Gone?
Anyone involved in the resistance will be on their way to the coast by now. I ordered them to be put on a boat for Constantinople.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 31
You must get them to turn back.
No, I’d need to send a rider and nobody can be spared whilst we're securing the city.
Then let me go.
Nobody comes in or out except my men, until I say so.
But you must understand —
And you must understand that I’m trying to rebuild the Roman Empire, and I’m afraid I consider that to be of greater importance.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 32
19: EXT. RAVENNA STREET
F/X VICKI WANDERING THE STREETS, ENCOUNTERS A WOMAN.
His name’s Steven. Steven Taylor. Dark hair, strange clothes?
No, sorry.
All right — thank you anyway.
F/X SOPHIA APPROACHES HER.
Excuse me — was this man wearing a sort of blue tunic? And black shoes?
Yes! Have you seen him?
He was being taken away with the injured.
Where are they now?
Bound for Constantinople.
Oh no...
Is he your betrothed?
No no.
Then why are you so keen to find him?
(BEAT) Yes, actually he is. It’s a secret. We eloped together.
How romantic. I shall shortly be travelling on to Constantinople myself. I could show you the way to the port, if you like...?
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 33
I'd be very grateful, ev...
Sophia.
I’m Vicki.
F/X AS THEY WALK:
Is that where you’re from? Constantinople?
No no, I’m from Nikopolis (niCOPolis). Surely, you must have realised — you speak such good Greek.
Do I?
No need to be modest.
Why did you leave Greece?

Oh, they thought I was strange. I... did some strange things, it was better to leave. I couldn’t understand why I was different — but then a man, a stranger, came to my town. He talked to me, and explained why.
That was lucky. To find someone who understood.
Yes. Without him, I’d probably be dead...
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 34
20: INT. SHIP (BELOW DECKS
F/X AT SEA. CREAKING TIMBERS.
(COMING ROUND) Whu... where...?
Steady, my boy. Don’t try to get up.
What happened?
There was fighting in the city. You were injured.
I remember getting hit on the head... ow!
You’ve caught a blow from a sword across your chest. I’ve treated it as best I can... it seems to be healing well enough...
You pulled me out of the crowd. You saved my life. Who are you?
My name is Quintus.
Thank you, Quintus. (BEAT) Wait — are we on a ship?
Yes.
What? Why?
Any Goths captured in the siege are being taken to Constantinople to join the Roman army and fight the Persian menace.
Oh no — I’m not a Goth.
Oh. I thought you didn’t look like you were from round here.
I don’t even really know what one is. I was just visiting the Citys
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 35
Odd time to visit, in the middle of a siege. How did you get in? Fall out of the sky?
Not exactly. But my friends — the people I was travelling with — they’re back there.
I'm afraid it’s too late to turn back, but I’m sure I can sort this out with the captain. You’ll be a free man when we reach Constantinople...
But I’1ll be stranded there.
Look on the bright side. At least you’1ll be stranded in the finest city in the world.
F/X FADE.
THE SECRET HISTORY by Eddie Robson Page 36
21: INT. PALACE — THRONE ROOM
F/X PROCOPIUS RUSHES IN, FOLLOWED BY THE DOCTOR. AS BEFORE, WE
POSITIONED WITH BELISARIUS & THE OTHERS APPROACH US.
(OFF) Belisarius! A message has arrived for you.
It’s from the Emperor Justinian.
(SIGHS) Perhaps it’s a message of congratulations.
Er.. it has been only a matter of hours since you completed the occupation, so word of your victory won’t even reach him until
I think that was a joke, Procopius.
F/X BELISARIUS OPENS THE WAX SEAL & UNROLLS THE MESSAGE.
READS.
What in the name of — ?
What’s it say?
He wants us to return.
To Constantinople?
